info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 5 at 1:51AM MST until September 5 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. The USGS gauge on the Gila River near Dome has risen above Action Stage, with a stage height of 21 feet at 12:30 AM MST.
* WHERE...Primarily in the Gila River in Yuma County.
* WHEN...Until 900 AM MST Friday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 146 AM MST, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to earlier thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Castle Dome Wash, Gila River, Colorado River and Coyote Wash. Flooding is occurring along the Gila River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kinter. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING
